story.storykicker: The UGC in its latest notification has indicated that it will roll back the increased workload of teachers, that the new Academic Performance Index (API) criteria had initially proposed.
story.storybody:
Giving in to the demands of the protesting Delhi University teachers, on intervention of the Ministry of Human Resources and Development (HRD), the University Grants Commission (UGC) has stated that under the new norms the teaching workload will not increase.

The following points were made by the UGC in a statement:

  • The higher education regulator has initiated action on the review by the HRD Ministry of the recent amendment to the UGC (minimum qualifications for appointment of teachers and other academic staff in universities and colleges and measures for the maintenance of standards in higher education) Regulations, 2010.
  • In accordance with the ministry's direction, UGC would undertake amendments in the Regulation, signifying that the overall workload of Assistant Professors, Associate Professors and Professors in full employment would not change.
  • HRD ministry had directed that the direct teaching-learning hours per week to be devoted by Assistant Professors (16 hours) and Associate Professors/Professors (14 hours) too would remain same.
  • "As part of the process of the review mandated by the Ministry of HRD, UGC will invite representatives of teachers from across the country for stakeholder consultations on these issues. The Commission will also seek perspectives and suggestions from teachers for its consideration," the statement said, according to PTI.
